text: Mariá Álvarez Rios (June 5, 1919 - December 6, 2010) was a Cuban composer, pianist and educator. She was born in Tuinicú and studied music from a young age. She continued her studies at the University of Havana and the University of Michigan where she earned a doctorate in music. She wrote music to poems by Nicolás Guillén, José Martí, Félix Pita Rodríguez and Gabriela Mistral, and also wrote music for the stage; she was known for her contributions to children's music. == Selected works == * Abrazame amor, song * Anda di, corazo'n, song * Ya no me llamas, song * La rosa y el ruiseñor, song * Como se duele, song == References == Category:1919 births Category:2010 deaths Category:Cuban composers Category:University of Michigan School of Music, Theatre & Dance alumni Category:University of Havana alumni
title: Mariá Álvarez Rios
